main event: A bright yellow object with a tail was seen traversing a major portion of the sky in an estimated 30 seconds near Crystal, Minnesota on August 14, 1955.
interesting points: The object was six times the size of a pea held at arm's length, indicating it was quite large.
The object was bright yellow in color and had a bright yellow flame or trail protruding from the aft of the object.
The object was seen in the west and disappeared in the east, traversing a major portion of the sky in just 30 seconds.
The report considered the possibility that the object was a meteor, but noted that there was no evidence of any jet aircraft in the air at the time of the sighting.
The report was submitted by a student who just happened to look skyward and witness the event.
sighted object: A bright yellow object with a tail
